intro: Pugionium cornutum, commonly known as the horned spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive horn-like structures on its leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Pugionium cornutum is known for its toxic sap, which can cause skin irritation.
